meanings.definition: The most important or decisive point.
meanings.sent1: The crux of the matter is to always tell the truth.
meanings.sent2: Understanding the crux of the problem is key to finding a solution.
meanings.sent3: At the party, the crux of the joke made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was the crux of her charm, lighting up the room.
meanings.sent5: The crux of the story was the unexpected plot twist.

meanings.sent4: His speech hit the crux of the matter, resonating with the audience.
meanings.sent5: The crux of the plan was to act quickly and decisively.
